did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Minutes of the Virginia Soil and Water Conservation Board,
did.origination: Virginia. Soil and Water Conservation Board

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: The Virginia Soil and Water Conservation Board was established by the General Assembly to help guide the delivery of soil and water conservation services to citizens of the Commonwealth. Its duties include oversight and support of the soil and water conservation districts of Virginia, oversight and enforcement of non-point source pollution control programs, oversight and enforcement of dam safety and floodplain management programs, and approval of loan criteria for loans from the Dam Safety, Flood Prevention and Protection Assistance Fund.

odd.p: These records are part of the Virginia Dept. of Conservation and Recreation record group (RG# 18)

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Minutes of the Virginia Soil and Water Conservation Board, [cite specific accession and date]. State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Accession 50768 was transferred by Virginia Soil and Water Conservation Board, 02/22/2013

controlaccess.corpname: Virginia. -- Soil and Water Conservation Board
Virginia. -- Dept. of Conservation and Recreation

scopecontent.p: Minutes, 1935-2011, of the meetings of the Virginia Soil and Water Conservation Board. Includes agendas, minutes, policies adopted by the Board, correspondence to and from the board, presentations given to the board, and material concerning proposed regulations.
